etymologies: early 19th century: from Latin American Spanish, of imitative origin

definitions: a tree-dwelling tropical American bird with colourful plumage, typically having two long racket-shaped tail feathers.

notes.text: Family Momotidae: several genera and species, in particular the widespread blue-crowned motmot (Momotus momota)

shortDefinitions: tree-dwelling tropical American bird with colourful plumage
